relevant_findings.skin: Cyanotic and cool skin with a mottled and swollen right hand; a black eschar, 1 cm in diameter, on the dorsum of the right hand.
relevant_findings.hand_movement: Able to move fingers, but with limited range of motion; swelling extended up the proximal forearm.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Skin became less cyanotic and developed a flushed, deep-red color; blue discoloration persisted over the fingers of the right hand distally. Urinary output improved.

relevant_findings.skin: Brown circular area of necrotic skin, 2 cm in diameter on the mid-dorsum of the right hand; soft tissue of the hand and wrist erythematous and swollen.
relevant_findings.hand_movement: Unable to move fingers more than 2 to 3 mm; severe pain with passive motion.
